channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: DHS plans to use military bases in New Jersey and Indiana to detain immigrants
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security plans to use military bases in New Jersey and Indiana to detain immigrants amid its broader crackdown.

item.title: Rep. Ritchie Torres says Democrats should pursue redistricting to counter Texas GOP
item.description: NPR speaks with U.S. Rep. Ritchie Torres, D-N.Y, who says Democrats should pursue redistricting in blue states in response to Texas Republicans who are making the same effort.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Israeli ground troops push into central Gaza, Homeland Security plans to use military bases in New Jersey and Indiana to detain migrants, lawyers for Harvard and Trump square off in court.

item.title: Israel expands military operation into central Gaza
item.description: For the first time in 21 months of war, Israeli ground troops have pushed into central Gaza. Palestinians sheltering in several areas there have been ordered to evacuate.

item.title: Remembering actor Malcolm-Jamal Warner, who has died at age 54
item.description: Actor, director and musician Malcolm-Jamal Warner, best known for his role as the sweet teenager Theo Huxtable on "The Cosby Show," has died at age 54. NPR looks at the legacy he leaves behind.

item.title: Maryland state senator aims to change how juvenile offenders are treated in the state
item.description: In Maryland, more youth are tried as adults than in almost any other state. State Sen. William Smith is on a mission to change that.

item.title: FAA investigating near miss in N.D. between passenger plane and B-52 bomber
item.description: A flight from Minneapolis to Minot {MYE-not}, North Dakota, had a near miss encounter Friday with a military aircraft. A pilot was forced to make an abrupt maneuver to avoid colliding with a B-52.

item.title: A look at President Trump's lawsuit against Rupert Murdoch
item.description: In a clash of conservative titans, President Trump sued Rupert Murdoch after the '"Wall Street Journal" published a story about a bawdy birthday card Trump made for the late Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Are Trump's supporters showing signs of moving on from the Jeffrey Epstein story?
item.description: Is President Trump's tactic of distracting his base and the media away from the Jeffrey Epstein story working? NPR speaks with Puck News journalist Leigh Ann Caldwell.

item.title: Former officer gets 33 months in prison for violating Breonna Taylor's rights
item.description: Former Louisville police officer Brett Hankison was sentenced to 33 months in prison for violating Breonna Taylor's civil rights during the 2020 botched raid that killed her.
